title: IT Spending in Remote Healthcare Delivery Market – Trends, Forecast & Growth Prospects Unveiled by Technavio
text:
IT Spending in Remote Healthcare Delivery Market – Trends, Forecast & Growth Prospects Unveiled by Technavio GE Healthcare, McKesson, and Philips Healthcare are three key vendors highlighted in a new Technavio report October 02, 2015 10:35 AM Eastern Daylight Time 
LONDON--( BUSINESS WIRE )--Technavio has published a new report on the global IT spending in remote healthcare delivery market ,which is expected to grow at a CAGR of over 25% from 2015-2019. 
IT spending in remote healthcare delivery market segmentation including product and geography 
Technavio’s report analyses the solutions and products offered by market vendors and presents a comprehensive breakdown in terms of market segmentation for different products, including telehealth and mHealth. 
Additionally, analysts have segmented market projections by key geography, focusing on the Americas, EMEA, and the APAC region. 
The new report by Technavio also emphasizes the growing adoption of robo-doctor, which is driven by the lack of physicians and doctors in rural areas. 
“Robotic surgery can also help remove cancerous tissue effectively with less disruption compared to other traditional methods of surgery. The increasing investment in robotic technology for telehealth will boost IT spending in the forecast period,” says Faisal Ghaus, Vice President of Technavio. 
IT spending in remote healthcare delivery: Market scope and calculation of market size 
This report covers the present scenario and growth prospects for the global IT spending in remote healthcare delivery market from 2015-2019. To calculate the market size, we consider the capital spent on IT for delivering healthcare services through telehealth and mHealth.
